learning_outcomes.description: Recognise and explain the role of machine learning for business.
Explain the key concepts in machine learning for business.
Apply the methods of machine learning to business.
Compare and critically evaluate the methods of machine learning.
Demonstrate how applications of machine learning can inform and improve business performance.

assessments.task_description:
This first assessment item is a project proposal outlining the application of machine learning to business. The proposal is an individual and written assessment item. My expectation is students will write proposals in the range of 1,500 to 2,000 words. The proposal should contain several key components.

1. Background statement

2. Conceptual development

3. Variable selection

4. Methods of analysis/analysis plan

5. Form of the results

6. Next steps

More details of criteria and suggestions for approaching each section of the proposal will be discussed in class and provided in written form on Blackboard. Note students are expected to submit their proposals in Word format.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) provides emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI in each instance.

A failure to reference AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
The project report is intended as an extension of the project plan. The plan proposed a possible direction for your project – sketching a way to address a binary classification problem. The project report restates key elements of the plan and context, documents the methods and results of your project, and highlights the implications for the client (“the bank”). Note the project report should be prepared and submitted in PowerPoint format (whereas the project plan was in the form of a Word document). Further, you are asked to make a recording of a presentation (presenting your PowerPoint doc) and submit your R script. The project report will likely have the following sections.

1. Background

2. Business problem

3. Proposed solution/method of analysis

4. Data

5. Analysis plan

6. Results and interpretation

7. Strategy/recommendations

8. Conclusion/research directions

More details of criteria and suggestions for approaching each section of the report will be discussed in class and provided in written form on Blackboard. Note students are expected to submit their proposals in PowerPoint format and further, record and submit a recording of their presentations.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) provides emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
